description: Supported languages configuration for multilingual interface

USAGE_GUIDE.purpose: Defines all supported languages for the multilingual configurator. Backend uses LLM translation, frontend uses static translations.
loaded_by: configuration_service.py - Loads language metadata via get_supported_languages()
translator.py - Uses for LLM-based translation validation and language name mapping
Frontend translations.js - Uses language codes and names for UI language selector
what_it_controls: Which languages are available in the UI language selector
Language code to display name mapping

adding_new_language.step_1: Add new language object to supported_languages array
adding_new_language.step_2: Set code to ISO 639-1 code (e.g., 'nl' for Dutch, 'ja' for Japanese)
adding_new_language.step_3: Set name to English name, native_name to native language name
adding_new_language.step_4: Set llm_translation_enabled: true (backend will use GPT-4 for translation)
adding_new_language.step_5: Set fallback_translations_available based on whether you have static translations
adding_new_language.step_6: Update frontend/translations.js with static UI translations for new language
adding_new_language.step_7: Test translation quality with sample queries

modifying_existing_language.disable_llm: Set llm_translation_enabled: false to disable GPT-4 translation (use fallback only)
modifying_existing_language.change_default: Move is_default: true to different language to change system default
modifying_existing_language.add_fallback: Set fallback_translations_available: true and add translations to translator.py FALLBACK_TRANSLATIONS

translation_settings.use_llm_for_dynamic_content: If true, uses GPT-4 for translating dynamic content (product search results, prompts)
translation_settings.use_fallback_for_common_phrases: If true, uses static translations for common phrases (faster, cheaper than LLM)
translation_settings.cache_translations: If true, caches translated text to avoid repeated API calls
translation_settings.translation_timeout_seconds: Max time to wait for LLM translation before falling back. Default: 10s

backend_vs_frontend.backend: Uses this file + OpenAI GPT-4 for dynamic translation (product names, search results, prompts)
backend_vs_frontend.frontend: Uses translations.js for static UI text (buttons, labels, placeholders) - does NOT use this file directly

IMPORTANT_NOTES.llm_translation_cost: GPT-4 translation costs tokens - only enable for languages without static translations
IMPORTANT_NOTES.fallback_strategy: If LLM translation fails, system falls back to FALLBACK_TRANSLATIONS in translator.py, then English
quality_considerations: LLM translations are high-quality but cost tokens and have latency
Static fallback translations are instant but limited to common phrases
Product-specific terminology may need review for accuracy
IMPORTANT_NOTES.validation: No schema file - validate by running translator tests: pytest tests/unit/services/test_translator.py
related_configs: state_prompts.json - Contains English prompts that get translated
llm_config.json - LLM settings for translation model (temperature, tokens)
